channel.title: Papers with Code: Trending (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: Harnessing the Power of LLMs in Practice: A Survey on ChatGPT and Beyond
item.description: This paper presents a comprehensive and practical guide for practitioners and end-users working with Large Language Models (LLMs) in their downstream natural language processing (NLP) tasks.

item.title: Track Anything: Segment Anything Meets Videos
item.description: Therefore, in this report, we propose Track Anything Model (TAM), which achieves high-performance interactive tracking and segmentation in videos.

item.title: AudioGPT: Understanding and Generating Speech, Music, Sound, and Talking Head
item.description: In this work, we propose a multi-modal AI system named AudioGPT, which complements LLMs (i. e., ChatGPT) with 1) foundation models to process complex audio information and solve numerous understanding and generation tasks; and 2) the input/output interface (ASR, TTS) to support spoken dialogue.

item.title: WizardLM: Empowering Large Language Models to Follow Complex Instructions
item.description: By analyzing the human evaluation results of the high complexity part, we demonstrate that outputs from our WizardLM model are preferred to outputs from OpenAI ChatGPT.

item.title: Text-to-Audio Generation using Instruction-Tuned LLM and Latent Diffusion Model
item.description: The immense scale of the recent large language models (LLM) allows many interesting properties, such as, instruction- and chain-of-thought-based fine-tuning, that has significantly improved zero- and few-shot performance in many natural language processing (NLP) tasks.

item.title: Adafactor: Adaptive Learning Rates with Sublinear Memory Cost
item.description: In several recently proposed stochastic optimization methods (e. g. RMSProp, Adam, Adadelta), parameter updates are scaled by the inverse square roots of exponential moving averages of squared past gradients.

item.title: Tool Learning with Foundation Models
item.description: Considering the lack of a systematic tool learning evaluation in prior works, we experiment with 17 representative tools and show the potential of current foundation models in skillfully utilizing tools.

item.title: Segment Everything Everywhere All at Once
item.description: Inspired by the development of prompt-based universal interfaces for LLMs, this paper presents SEEM, a promptable, interactive model for Segmenting Everything Everywhere all at once in an image.

item.title: Segment Anything in Medical Images
item.description: Comprehensive experiments on 21 3D segmentation tasks and 9 2D segmentation tasks demonstrate that MedSAM outperforms the default SAM model with an average Dice Similarity Coefficient (DSC) of 22. 5% and 17. 6% on 3D and 2D segmentation tasks, respectively.

item.title: Unleashing Infinite-Length Input Capacity for Large-scale Language Models with Self-Controlled Memory System
item.description: To address this limitation, we propose the Self-Controlled Memory (SCM) system to unleash infinite-length input capacity for large-scale language models.

item.title: Inpaint Anything: Segment Anything Meets Image Inpainting
item.description: We are also very willing to help everyone share and promote new projects based on our Inpaint Anything (IA).

item.title: DataComp: In search of the next generation of multimodal datasets
item.description: To address this shortcoming in the machine learning ecosystem, we introduce DataComp, a benchmark where the training code is fixed and researchers innovate by proposing new training sets.

item.title: Aligning benchmark datasets for table structure recognition
item.description: However, even if a dataset's annotations are self-consistent, there may be significant inconsistency across datasets, which can harm the performance of models trained and evaluated on them.

item.title: JaxPruner: A concise library for sparsity research
item.description: This paper introduces JaxPruner, an open-source JAX-based pruning and sparse training library for machine learning research.

item.title: Robust Speech Recognition via Large-Scale Weak Supervision
item.description: We study the capabilities of speech processing systems trained simply to predict large amounts of transcripts of audio on the internet.

item.title: MiniGPT-4: Enhancing Vision-Language Understanding with Advanced Large Language Models
item.description: To examine this phenomenon, we present MiniGPT-4, which aligns a frozen visual encoder with a frozen LLM, Vicuna, using just one projection layer.

item.title: LaMini-LM: A Diverse Herd of Distilled Models from Large-Scale Instructions
item.description: To this end, we carefully develop a large set of 2. 58M instructions based on both existing and newly-generated instructions.

item.title: Language Models Enable Simple Systems for Generating Structured Views of Heterogeneous Data Lakes
item.description: Code synthesis is cheap, but far less accurate than directly processing each document with the LLM.

item.title: mPLUG-Owl: Modularization Empowers Large Language Models with Multimodality
item.description: Our code, pre-trained model, instruction-tuned models, and evaluation set are available at https://github. com/X-PLUG/mPLUG-Owl.

item.title: DINOv2: Learning Robust Visual Features without Supervision
item.description: The recent breakthroughs in natural language processing for model pretraining on large quantities of data have opened the way for similar foundation models in computer vision.
